incidents.name: On Call Engineers are Investigating an issue

incident_updates.body: We will close the post on Twilio’s Status Page. If you have been impacted by this incident and wish to continue to receive updates, please open a ticket with customer support.
Our monitoring systems have detected a potential issue with Super Sim. Our engineering team has been alerted and is actively investigating. We will update as soon as we have more information.

incidents.name: SMS Delivery Delays to MTN Network in Nigeria

incident_updates.body: We are still experiencing SMS delivery delays when sending messages to MTN Network in Nigeria. However, since we also have an active post for SMS delivery delays when sending messages to Afghanistan and multiple countries in Africa via a subset of Twilio numbers, we have consolidated all impacting services in to one incident. You can check the status of this here: https://status.twilio.com/incidents/pj658yj16prt

incident_updates.body: We have fully investigated the WhatsApp inbound messages failures, and it was determined that the impact was limited to a small set of customers, who have been contacted individually to address any concerns. All systems are operational.
We’re investigating an issue with Whatsapp inbound messages failures for a subset of customers. We expect to provide another update in 1 hour or as soon as more information becomes available.

Our monitoring systems have detected a potential issue with Whatsapp Inbound Messages. Our engineering team has been alerted and is actively investigating. We will update as soon as we have more information.

incidents.name: Multiple Product Errors in IE1

incident_updates.body: All services are recovered except for Accounts API; specifically, accounts created via Accounts API since approximately 2:10AM PT on 7 December 2023 are unavailable in IE1 region. Teams are working to restore normal functionality. We will provide another update in 12 hours or as soon as more information is available.

All services are recovered except for Accounts API; specifically, accounts created via Accounts API since approximately 2:10AM PT on 7 December 2023 are unavailable in IE1 region. Teams are working to restore normal functionality. We will provide another update in 4 hours or as soon as more information is available.

All services are recovered except for Accounts API; specifically, accounts created via Accounts API since approximately 2:10AM PT on 7 December 2023 are unavailable in IE1 region. Teams are working to restore normal functionality. We will provide another update in 2 hours or as soon as more information is available.

We are continuing to see recovery across multiple Twilio products. We will continue monitoring to ensure full service stability. We will provide another update in 2 hours or as soon as more information becomes available.

We are continuing to see recovery across multiple Twilio products. We will continue monitoring to ensure full service stability. We will provide another update in 30 mins or as soon as more information becomes available.

Note: We are making a correction about the previous post; neither SMS nor Programmable Video > Group Rooms were impacted by this incident

We are starting to see recovery across several products. Currently, our engineering teams are reviewing  their services to ensure they are operating normally and remain stable. We will provide another update in 30 mins or as soon as more information becomes available.

Customers will be seeing an elevated error rate and latency for Conversations and Programmable Chat API-s and SDK-s in the IE1 region. Our engineering team has been alerted and is actively investigating. We will provide another update in 30 mins or as soon as more information becomes available.

incidents.name: Subset of API requests are failing when rendering the Console

incident_updates.body: The issue with subset of API requests has been resolved and the Twilio Console is operating normally at this time.

We continue to see a high rate of failure for listing and switching subaccounts in Console. Additionally, some users are experiencing “An error occurred” error messages on various pages throughout Console. We expect to provide another update in 2 hours or as soon as more information becomes available.

There is a high rate of failure for listing and switching subaccounts in Console. Additionally, some users are experiencing “An error occurred” error messages on various pages throughout Console. We expect to provide another update in 1 hour or as soon as more information becomes available.

We are currently seeing a small subset of API requests are failing when rendering the Console, resulting in the "Something went wrong" error message. Our engineering team is looking into the issue. We expect to provide another update in 1 hour or as soon as more information becomes available.

incidents.name: Our Engineers are Investigating an Issue with Lookup API

incident_updates.body: Twilio Lookup API was degraded for 111 minutes between 12:30 and 02:21AM Pacific Time on 12/05/2023. During this period of time due customers may have experienced errors  for the caller_name package when using the Lookup API. After working with our vendor, the issue has now been resolved.

Twilio Lookup API was degraded for 111 minutes between 12:30 and 02:21AM Pacific Time on 12/05/2023. During this period of time due customers may have experienced errors  for the caller_name package when using the Lookup API. After working with our vendor, the issue has now been resolved.

incidents.name: Flex Insights Delays and Errors

incident_updates.body: Twilio Flex Insights was degraded for 45 minutes between 10:45 am and 11:30 Pacific Time on 12/04/2023. During this period of time customers may have experienced delays and errors loading the page on Twilio console. The issue has now been resolved.

incidents.name: AccSec Verizon US API Error - Unsupported Subscriber

incident_updates.body: The incident affecting Verify API Silent Network Auth method which caused users to receive an "Unsupported Subscriber" error response has now been resolved. It was determined that the incident was related to incompatible handsets and was not caused by degraded carrier performance. The service is operational at this time.

We have started seeing recovery for Verify-Silent Network Auth. We will continue to monitor to ensure a full recovery. We expect to provide another update on 12/04/2023 at 12:00 pm PST or as soon as more information becomes available.

incidents.name: SMS Onboarding in Console Issues

incident_updates.body: Twilio Console in getting started with Messaging in a new account errors has been resolved and Twilio Console is operating normally at this time.

Twilio Console in getting started with Messaging in a new account is now operating normally. We will continue to monitor for system stability. We'll provide another update in 30 minutes
 or as soon as more information becomes available.

We are currently investigating errors when getting started with Messaging in a new account in the Twilio Console. Our engineers are working on the issue, and we will provide another update in 1 hour or as soon as more information becomes available.
Our monitoring systems have detected a potential issue Twilio Console. Our engineering team has been alerted and is actively investigating. We will update as soon as we have more information.

incidents.name: LTE-M Connectivity on Telefonica O2 in the United Kingdom Blocked

incident_updates.body:
We are aware of devices being unable to connect to the LTE-M network on O2 in the United Kingdom. O2 has, without notice, blocked all inbound LTE-M traffic from SIMs roaming on their network. This is not just impacting our products, but also products from other providers roaming onto O2’s network. We are engaged with our multiple tier-1 carrier partners who have also been impacted and are working toward a resolution of this matter.
O2 is the only LTE-M network in the UK to which Super SIM can connect. Devices able to use 2G, which many LTE-M modems also support, should have been able to maintain their connectivity by connecting to various 2G networks offered in the UK. If you are planning to release LTE-M enabled devices into the UK, please ensure they also support 2G and that it’s enabled for fallback on your devices. 
There is currently no timeline for when LTE-M connectivity on O2 will be restored for SIMs roaming onto their network. We do not expect this matter to be resolved in a matter of days. We intend to keep this incident posted until Monday, December 11th, after which it will be closed. We will provide updates if we get any new details. If you would like to receive updates about this matter after this status is closed, please open a support ticket with KORE’s customer support team referencing this incident. Learn more about the support transition for IoT products to KORE and how to open a ticket with KORE here: https://www.twilio.com/docs/iot/kore-acquisition/iot-customer-support-migration-to-kore
Our monitoring systems have detected a potential issue with SuperSIM. Our engineering team has been alerted and is actively investigating. We will update as soon as we have more information.

incidents.name: Account Switcher Page Not Loading

incident_updates.body: Twilio Account switcher page was degraded for 15 minutes between 8:30 and 8:45 Pacific Time on 11/30/2023. During this period of time customers may have experienced issues loading this page in twilio console. The issue has now been resolved.
